Description: A man's embroidered jacket with long sleeves. Centre front opening, straight sides. Ground made from blue/purple fulled wool cloth, commercially made. Sleeves set in at right angles. Black wool braiding applied to all edges, including long vents at bottom of sleeves, and on the jacket's seams. Braiding couched to form diamond patterning at sleeve cuff, and two large leaved motifs, joined to a central stem, couched over pocket, one on each side of centre front. Eleven decorative (non-functional) fabric buttons on sleeves. Jacket lined with blue woven cotton and grey twill woven cotton cloth. Another shield-shaped inside pocket on each side. Lower sleeve lined with purple moiré silk cloth (tabby woven).
Production place: Made in: Libya (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Jordan (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Curator's comments: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 9: 'Arab' and 'Five pieces comprising an Arab costume'; Asia Collections storage intake book: 'Middle East'. In the opinion of Sahar el-Sayed (textile curator, Cairo Textile Museum) these clothes are festive dress, worn by a man living in a rural environment. Garment worn with As1979,14 .2 waistcoat .3 coat .4 shawl, scarf .5 coat, 'abaya'
